definition: the final bell (esp. in sports competition)

sentences.english: The women of the house seemed not to feel that the sound had meaning for them.
sentences.chinese: 家中的女人們感到這鑼聲跟她們無關。

sentences.english: In the mid-day the gong sounds at the palace gate.
sentences.chinese: 中午，鑼聲在廟殿門前敲起。

sentences.english: On the stroke of seven, a gong summons guests into the dining-room.
sentences.chinese: 7點整時一陣鑼聲將客人召集到餐廳。

sentences.english: The sound of three bangs on a gong signalled the impending arrival of Kim’s son and grandson.
sentences.chinese: 三聲鑼聲宣示金日成的兒子和孫子的即將到來。

sentences.english: The room resounded wtih each beat of the gong.
sentences.chinese: 這間屋子迴盪着陣陣鑼聲。

sentences.english: Today's art lesson came to an abrupt end when the gongs sounded for a fire drill.
sentences.chinese: 今天的藝術課是乏味的，鑼聲像刺耳的鑽子。

definition: Dacun township in Changhua county 彰化縣|彰化县[Zhang1 hua4 xian4], Taiwan
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
lit. to use the eastern wind (idiom)/fig. to use sb's help
